metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6460 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient data validation in URL formatting in Google Chrome prior to 81.0.4044.122 allowed a remote attacker to perform domain spoofing via a crafted domain name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6460` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
